116.customerMessage1: Take care of my order mix up please
116.AgentMessage1: Comfrt: I'm sorry about that! Can you share with me what you need help with?
116.customerMessage2: I've tried repeatedly to email info@comfrt.com but keep getting a canned message back. I was so pleased at first that they were taking care of the order mixup but then I never received a tracking number and still haven't received my (s) seafoam hoodie
116.customerMessage3: I had been such a fan of the brand. This has left me frustrated
116.AgentMessage2: Comfrt: I apologize for the frustration and inconvenience this has caused. This is not the experience we strive to provide for our customers. Since you already received an email from my team, it would be best to reply to them using the same email thread for any further requests. Please also check your spam and promo folders as well, as our emails sometimes end up there.
116.customerMessage4: I've done that repeatedly to no avail
116.customerMessage5: Nothing in junk/spam. Does this mean you're not going to do anything? Check on it?
116.AgentMessage3: Comfrt: I'm so sorry that I can't help with this directly, but my system isn't set up for this type of issue. Our team is doing everything to respond to each inquiry in a timely manner. They should follow up with you in no time!
116.customerMessage6: I cannot tell you how frustrated I am. I've even direct message Instagram. There's no way to get ahold of anyone at your company. I want what I paid for
116.customerMessage7: You should be able to forward it to the right people so it gets flagged
116.customerMessage8: I email and I get this message. I've already submitted online. It gets me nowhere
116.customerMessage9: I know you personally are not at fault. Sorry if it feels I'm taking it out on you. I just don't know how to get my item
116.AgentMessage4: Comfrt: I understand your concern and frustration. Based on the email I see on the 14th, it was routed to our fulfillment team to ship out. I know the timing is not ideal, but I'm afraid multiple emails for the same issue that's already being resolved can sometimes cause delays. Rest assured, the request was already sent over, and we're working to get the item shipped out.

dos_and_donts: Do not tell customers that the base price is the final price! The cost changes by the fitment and depends on the vehicle
Rebates are discounts for this brand!
Custom dim pattern sheets are only available for Vehicle Covers (Car, Truck, Van,RV)

119.customerMessage1: I already ordered a set of charcoal seat covers front and back for my 2025 GMC sierra 84. However, what I received were gray covers then all Covercraft is doing about it is giving me 10% off. Not real happy.
119.AgentMessage1: Covercraft: I'm so sorry to hear this; it's not the experience I want you to have. Just to be sure, did you reach out to our customer support team regarding this directly at sales@covercraft.com?
119.customerMessage2: I did and they're not willing to do anything more so now I'm stuck with these seat covers that don't match my truck. Not the way a supposedly reputable company should be treating customers.
119.AgentMessage2: Covercraft: I completely understand your concern, and I'm sorry for any inconvenience. Can you please send me a photo of the items that you received, along with your order number and email address? I'll be more than happy to check this with the team.
119.customerMessage3: Please find attached the photos of the seat covers I received. I went through this with your customer care team sent them photos and again all they're offering is 10% off. If you look at the website for endure precision, fit seat covers and select charcoal, you'll see that that color is different than the color I received. The whole reason I selected Covercraft is because you had the color to match my truck otherwise I would've gone with a different company and saved $250. So it appears to me that they put the wrong product tag on the seat covers when they were produced in Mexico, but who knows. Either way the ones I received are much lighter than what I see on the website. Order # is 0002270886. My email is krhodes11@comcast.net.
119.AgentMessage3: Covercraft: Thank you for sending those over, and I understand. Let me check on this with my team, and I'll get back to you as soon as I have more information. I'll keep you updated!

escalate: Esc inquiries about items not on the site
ESC if the cx missed a sale & wants to take advantage of it
ESC if the customer is asking for a discount and we don't have one
If cx is looking for general recommendations use LFR shortcut and ESC
templates: If cx is building a new home, interested in refurnishing their entire home or rooms in their home, use the IDS shortcut
If cx is shopping for a client use SFC shortcut
Any convo without a positive outcome (out of stock, not on sale, not shipping in time), use DSS shortcut
dos_and_donts: For product-specific delivery time-frame inquiries always check the product page for delivery info and share that with the cx
